registers.name: battery_config_depth_of_discharge
registers.desc: Dod indicates the max discharge power, when SOC<1-DOD, inverter will stop power discharge , inverter will stop power discharge caused by other issues.        DOD<=EOD

registers.name: battery_config_end_of_discharge
registers.desc: EOD indicate the max discharge power on off grid mode, when SOC<1-EOD, inverter will stop power discharge , inverter will stop power discharge caused by other issues

ha.name: Time of use - Days of week

registers.name: desired_power
registers.desc: Desired PCC power in passive mode(-999999 to 999999) in watts
registers.desc3: Reading 0x1189 will always return 0. Min is typically -6000 or the value set to 0x1189. Max is typically +6000 or the value set to 0x1189

registers.name: minimum_battery_power
registers.desc: Minimum battery power in passive mode(-999999 to 999999) in watts

registers.name: maximum_battery_power
registers.desc: Maximum battery power in passive mode(-999999 to 999999) in watts

registers.name: eps_wait_time
registers.desc: Waiting time for emergency power start

registers.name: active_power_export_limit
registers.desc: AC output active power maximum percentage (0 to 100%)

registers.name: active_power_import_limit
registers.desc: AC input active power maximum percentage (0 to 100%)

registers.name: active_power_limit_speed
registers.desc: The charge rate of active power (1 to 3000%)

registers.name: reactive_power_response_time
registers.desc: Reactive power response time in secs (0.1 to 600)

registers.name: passive_timeout
registers.desc: Passive mode timeout period in secs (0=Never)
registers.desc2: When the inverter does not receive any communication frame within time set in this register the inverter forces Passive_Timeout_Action

registers.name: desired_power_grid
registers.desc: Maximum power to grid in passive mode(-999999 to 999999) in watts

1.name: GridOVP
1.description: The grid voltage is too high
1.solution: If the alarm occurs occasionally, the possible cause is that the electric grid is abnormal occasionally. Inverter will automatically return to normal operating status when the electric grid’s back to normal. If the alarm occurs frequently, check whether the grid voltage/frequency is within the acceptable range. If yes, please check the AC circuit breaker and AC wiring of the inverter. If the grid voltage/frequency is NOT within the acceptable range and AC wiring is correct, but the alarm occurs repeatedly, contact technical support to change the grid protection points after obtaining approval from the local electrical grid operator.

2.name: GridUVP
2.description: The grid voltage is too low

3.name: GridOFP
3.description: The grid frequency is too high

4.name: GridUFP
4.description: The grid frequency is too low

5.name: GFCI
5.solution: Internal faults of inverter, switch OFF inverter, wait for 5 minutes, then switch ON inverter. Check whether the problem is solved. If no, please contact technical support.

18.name: HwADFaultDCI(AC)
18.description: Wrong sampling of DC component of grid current

23.name: HwADFaultDCV
23.description: Error in DC component sampling of load voltage

42.name: IsoFault
42.solution: Check the insulation resistance between the photovoltaic array and ground. If there is a short circuit, repair the fault in time.

43.name: PEConnectFault
43.solution: Check AC output PE wire for grounding.

44.name: PvConfigError
44.solution: Check the PV input mode (parallel/independent). If incorrect, change the PV input mode.

45.name: CTDisconnect
45.solution: Check whether the CT wiring is correct.

49.name: TempFault_Bat
49.solution: Ensure inverter is installed in a cool, ventilated place, not in direct sunlight, and ambient temperature is below inverter limits.

65.name: VbusRmsUnbalance
65.solution: Internal fault. Switch OFF inverter, wait 5 minutes, then switch ON. If unresolved, contact technical support.

66.name: VbusInstantUnbalance
66.description: Transient value of bus voltage unbalanced
66.solution: Internal fault. Switch OFF inverter, wait 5 minutes, then switch ON. If unresolved, contact technical support.

69.name: PVOVP
69.solution: Check whether PV series voltage (Voc) exceeds inverter max input voltage. Reduce number of modules in series if needed.

70.name: BatOVP
70.solution: Check whether the battery overvoltage setting matches battery specifications.

71.name: LLCBusOVP
71.solution: Internal fault. Switch OFF inverter, wait 5 minutes, then switch ON. If unresolved, contact technical support.

72.name: SwBusRmsOVP
72.description: Inverter bus voltage RMS software overvoltage

73.name: SwBusInstantOVP
73.description: Inverter bus voltage instantaneous value software overvoltage

110.name: Overload1
110.solution: Check whether the inverter is operating under overload.

113.name: OverTempDerating
113.solution: Ensure inverter is installed in a cool, ventilated place, not in direct sunlight, and ambient temperature is below limits.

114.name: FreqDerating
114.solution: Ensure grid frequency and voltage are within acceptable range.

124.name: BatLowVoltageAlarm
124.solution: Check whether the battery voltage of the inverter is too low.

129.name: unrecoverHwAcOCP
129.solution: Internal fault. Switch OFF inverter, wait 5 minutes, then switch ON. If unresolved, contact technical support.

133.name: unrecoverEPSBatOCP
133.description: Permanent battery overcurrent failure in EPS mode

135.name: unrecoverIacUnbalance
135.description: Permanent failure of unbalanced output current

137.name: unrecoverPvConfigError
137.description: Input mode setting error permanent failure
137.solution: Check the PV input mode (parallel/independent). If incorrect, change the PV input mode.

145.name: USBFault
145.solution: Check the USB port of the inverter.

146.name: WifiFault
146.solution: Check the Wifi port of the inverter.

147.name: BluetoothFault
147.solution: Check the Bluetooth connection of the inverter.

148.name: RTCFault
148.solution: Internal fault. Switch OFF inverter, wait 5 minutes, then switch ON. If unresolved, contact technical support.

149.name: CommEEPROMFault
149.solution: Internal fault. Switch OFF inverter, wait 5 minutes, then switch ON. If unresolved, contact technical support.

156.name: SoftVerError
156.solution: Contact technical support for software upgrades.

157.name: BMS1CommunicatonFault
157.solution: Ensure battery is compatible with inverter. CAN communication recommended. Check communication line or port for faults.

161.name: ForceShutdown
161.solution: The inverter has performed a forced shutdown.

162.name: RemoteShutdown
162.solution: The inverter has performed a remote shutdown.

163.name: Drms0Shutdown
163.solution: The inverter has performed a Drms0 shutdown.

165.name: RemoteDerating
165.solution: The inverter is performing remote load reduction.

166.name: LogicInterfaceDerating
166.solution: The inverter is derated by the execution logic interface.

167.name: AlarmAntiRefluxing
167.solution: The inverter is preventing countercurrent load drop.

177.name: BMS OVP
177.solution: Internal battery failure. Close inverter and battery, wait 5 minutes, then restart. If unresolved, contact technical support.

181.name: BMS OCP
181.description: Warning of overload in charge and discharge of BMS
